class calculation.aperture.Aperture(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: HasTraits

classmethod from_dict(data)[source]

Creates an Aperture instance from a dictionary

get_slit_end_correction(x: float, y: float) → float[source]

Calculates the end correction after the equation given in Mechel’s “Formulas of Acoustics”, p. 319

Args:

x (float): width of slit y (float): height of slit

get_tube_correction(ending)[source]
to_dict()[source]

Returns the aperture as a dictionary, including only relevant fields based on form.

calculation.medium module

class calculation.medium.Medium(**kwargs)[source]

Bases: HasTraits

calc_density()[source]

calculate density based on Magnus equation. Depends on relative humidity and temperature

calc_kinematic_viscosity()[source]

calculation based on sutherland’s formula [GPT]

calc_speed_of_sound()[source]

This is an approximation according to DIN ISO 9613-1:1993

calculation.simulation module

class calculation.simulation.Simulation(resonator: Resonator, sim_params: SimulationParameters)[source]

Bases: object

calc_absorbtion_area() → array[source]

calculates the absorbtion area over a frequency vector

calc_all()[source]
calc_max_absorbtion_area(plot: bool = True)[source]
calc_q_factor() → float[source]

calculates absorbtion area’s Q factor

Returns:

float: Q-Factor

calc_resonance_frequency_and_peak_area() → float[source]

returns the resonance frequency calculated as maximum of the absorbtion area

Returns:

float: resonance frequency

calc_z_friction() → array[source]

calculate the real-valued viscosity loss

calc_z_porous() → float[source]

calculates the real, frequency-invariant porous absorbtion in case additional dampening material is used

calc_z_radiation() → array[source]

calculates complex, frequency-dependant acoustic radiation impedance (“Schallstrahlungsimpedanz”)

calc_z_stiff_mass() → array[source]

calculates impedance based on acoustic stiffness and mass. becomes zero at resonance frequency
